docs.text: PowerBI CLI # The Power BI command-line interface (Power BI CLI) is a set of commands used to create and manage Power BI resources (e.g. reports, users and capacity). The CLI is designed to get you working quickly with Power BI, with an emphasis on automation. References # https://github.com/andrewvillazon/pbipy https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/ https://typer.tiangolo.com/ https://powerbi-cli.github.io/index.html https://github.com/powerbi-cli/powerbi-cli
docs.title: PowerBI CLI

docs.text: The Power BI command-line interface (Power BI CLI) is a set of commands used to create and manage Power BI resources (e.g. reports, users and capacity). The CLI is designed to get you working quickly with Power BI, with an emphasis on automation.
docs.title: PowerBI CLI

docs.text: https://github.com/andrewvillazon/pbipy https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/power-bi/ https://typer.tiangolo.com/ https://powerbi-cli.github.io/index.html https://github.com/powerbi-cli/powerbi-cli
docs.title: References

docs.text: Installation # Pre-requisites # The Power BI CLI can use the autorisation flow of Azure CLI. To install the Azure CLI see the documentation: Install the Azure CLI Install # Use pipx to setup a standalone install: ❯ pipx install powerbi-cli
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: The Power BI CLI can use the autorisation flow of Azure CLI. To install the Azure CLI see the documentation: Install the Azure CLI
docs.title: Pre-requisites

docs.text: Use pipx to setup a standalone install: ❯ pipx install powerbi-cli
docs.title: Install

docs.text: CLI Reference # pbi # Base PowerBI CLi entrypoint Usage: pbi [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False admin # Interact with PowerBI Admin panel Usage: pbi admin [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False auth # Interact with PowerBI Auth Usage: pbi auth [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False token # Print the auth token Usage: pbi auth token [OPTIONS] Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False dataset # Interact with PowerBI Dataset Usage: pbi dataset [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False get # Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace Usage: pbi dataset get [OPTIONS] DATASET Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False list # List Dataset in given workspace Usage: pbi dataset list [OPTIONS] Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False query # Execute a DAX query against the Power BI XMLA endpoint Usage: pbi dataset query [OPTIONS] QUERY Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None -d , --dataset text N/A _required --help boolean Show this message and exit. False refresh # Interact with PowerBI Dataset Refresh Usage: pbi dataset refresh [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False start # Triggers a refresh for the specified dataset from the specified workspace. Usage: pbi dataset refresh start [OPTIONS] Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False report # Interact with PowerBI Reports Usage: pbi report [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False export # Download the report as .pbix or .rdl depending on the report Usage: pbi report export [OPTIONS] REPORT Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None -o , --output path N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False get # Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace Usage: pbi report get [OPTIONS] REPORT Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False list # List Reports in given workspace Usage: pbi report list [OPTIONS] WORKSPACE Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False open # Open a given report in the web browser Usage: pbi report open [OPTIONS] REPORT Options: Name Type Description Default -w , --workspace text N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False workspace # Interact with PowerBI Workspace Usage: pbi workspace [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]... Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False get # Get details about one Dataset in a given workspace Usage: pbi workspace get [OPTIONS] WORKSPACE Options: Name Type Description Default --help boolean Show this message and exit. False list- # List workspaces available Usage: pbi workspace list- [OPTIONS] Options: Name Type Description Default --top integer N/A None --help boolean Show this message and exit. False
docs.title: CLI Reference

docs.text: Samples for datasets # Command Description list List datasets from a given workspace query Execute a DAX query on a given dataset from a given workspace List datasets # List datasets the user/service principal has access to for a certain workspace $ pbi dataset list --workspace {WORKSPACE_ID} DATASET ID NAME CONFIGURED BY CREATED DATE ------------- ----------------- ----------------- ------------------------ DATASET_ID_1 DATASET_NAME_1 xxx@mycompany.com 2022-05-09T08:01:09.517Z DATASET_ID_2 DATASET_NAME_2 yyy@mycompany.com 2022-08-18T09:04:16.867Z Execute query # Executes a DAX query to a premium dataset $ pbi dataset query "EVALUATE ROW(\"distinct\", DISTINCTCOUNT('MyTable'[MyColumn]))" 2023-10-25 18:43:47 [info ] EVALUATE ROW("distinct", DISTINCTCOUNT('MyTable'[MyColumn])) dataset=<Dataset id='DATASET_ID', name='DATASET_NAME', group_id='WORKSPACE_ID', configured_by='xxx@mycompany.com', created_date='2023-10-12T09:51:56.407Z'> Duration: 0.1640009580005426 {'results': [{'tables': [{'rows': [{'[distinct]': 3602}]}]}]}
docs.title: Samples for datasets

docs.text: Command Description list List datasets from a given workspace query Execute a DAX query on a given dataset from a given workspace
docs.title: Samples for datasets
